componenttext: Your next question comes from Michelle Tan of Goldman Sachs.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Sharen, I was wondering if you could talk a little bit about the Naked launch, what you would do differently in the future. And then, any color on any of the upcoming launches or type of launches that you're thinking about for the back half.
componenttext: Sharen, I was wondering if you could talk a little bit about the Naked launch, what you would do differently in the future. And then, any color on any of the upcoming launches or type of launches that you're thinking about for the back half.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: The Naked launch exceeded our expectation, and we were very pleased with the Naked launch. The other thing that we were pleased with the Naked launch is that because it's an unlined bra, we not only did well with the Naked launch, at the same time, we als
componenttext: The Naked launch exceeded our expectation, and we were very pleased with the Naked launch. The other thing that we were pleased with the Naked launch is that because it's an unlined bra, we not only did well with the Naked launch, at the same time, we also saw increments in terms of our push up category. So we were very pleased with the performance. We have a very strong lineup of launches coming forward not only at the back half of the second quarter, but also as we go into the fall season.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from Jeff Stein of Soleil Securities.
componenttext: Your next question comes from Jeff Stein of Soleil Securities.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Question for Stuart. Stuart, it sounds to me like a lot of the improvements that you guys have made in terms of EBIT margin so far has come from better execution. So I'm wondering if you could just kind of talk about the flow-through in each of your core
componenttext: Question for Stuart. Stuart, it sounds to me like a lot of the improvements that you guys have made in terms of EBIT margin so far has come from better execution. So I'm wondering if you could just kind of talk about the flow-through in each of your core businesses and how that has changed? In other words, $1 of incremental sales flow through at X cents on $1 one or two years ago. Now, it flows through at Y. What would that relationship be today versus a couple of years ago?

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Maybe the way to overdo that [ph] is when business -- and I'm going to be plainspoken and, simplistic about it, but I think it makes the main point. When our business is not doing well, in some combination from the economy and our own execution, and our c
componenttext: Maybe the way to overdo that [ph] is when business -- and I'm going to be plainspoken and, simplistic about it, but I think it makes the main point. When our business is not doing well, in some combination from the economy and our own execution, and our comps are negative, the flow-through on sales change is going to be pretty significant. In terms of how that looks. A normal flow-through in the business would be in terms of $1 of increased sales. Normally, we'd see $0.30 to $0.40 of operating income flow-through. What we've had in the fourth quarter, particularly, and this first quarter is, we've had extraordinary flow-through. And particularly in this first quarter, we had sales growth, obviously. We had very substantial merchandise margin rate improvement, and then we got leverage on the buying and occupancy line and on the expense line as we continued to manage expenses pretty well. But this flow-through is extraordinary and the product of a lot of good, hard work. And overtime, as we lap better results, we'll get to that more normal flow-through of 30% to 40%. And again, that's to the operating income line.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: So would you characterize the first quarter flow-through rate as probably a rate that would not be sustainable?
componenttext: So would you characterize the first quarter flow-through rate as probably a rate that would not be sustainable?

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Absolutely. Now when I say extraordinary, I mean extraordinary. I, frankly, in my time in this business and in some others, I've never seen flow-throughs quite like this before in a very positive sense. And again, it's the product of everybody on this cal
componenttext: Absolutely. Now when I say extraordinary, I mean extraordinary. I, frankly, in my time in this business and in some others, I've never seen flow-throughs quite like this before in a very positive sense. And again, it's the product of everybody on this call and lots of other people working really hard to drive a good top line, to do all the things we're doing to improve merchandise margins and also managing expenses in a tough-minded disciplined way.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from Jennifer Black of Jennifer Black & Associates.
componenttext: Your next question comes from Jennifer Black of Jennifer Black & Associates.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: My question is for Sharen. I wondered if you could talk about the VSX and Shapewear. And are you making any changes to your catalog circulation?
componenttext: My question is for Sharen. I wondered if you could talk about the VSX and Shapewear. And are you making any changes to your catalog circulation?

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: We launched the Shapewear category this spring season in a pretty full-blown way in about 60 stores to get a test read. We were very pleased and really had been reacting with speed to be able to actually put that product in even more stores. So what that
componenttext:
We launched the Shapewear category this spring season in a pretty full-blown way in about 60 stores to get a test read. We were very pleased and really had been reacting with speed to be able to actually put that product in even more stores. So what that test allowed us to do is really test broad. Now we've focused into the real winners, and we are going to continue to expand that as we go into the fall season. So we're very excited about that. Our VSX business that right now is comping about 42% in the stores that it was in this year versus last year, so we still feel good about this category. And I think that as we think about our continued disciplined focus on the bra and panty category through 2010, hopefully, we'll see even more opportunity in VSX as we go through 2011.
Catalog situation, there is no change. And in fact, we're actually going to be publishing a new exclusive Pink catalog this back-to-school time frame. But the catalog circulation is not changing.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from John Morris of BMO Capital Markets.
componenttext: Your next question comes from John Morris of BMO Capital Markets.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Diane and Sharen, as you each look ahead to fall and holiday, where do you see the opportunity in the merchandise assortment to last year? Can you give us a couple of specific highlights of where that opportunity might be? And Martyn, on La Senza, is it p
componenttext: Diane and Sharen, as you each look ahead to fall and holiday, where do you see the opportunity in the merchandise assortment to last year? Can you give us a couple of specific highlights of where that opportunity might be? And Martyn, on La Senza, is it possible to bring that brand to the U.S. at some point? And if so, when could that be?

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Well, John, I probably can't give you some specifics on what we've got going forward in the fall-holiday season for many reasons, but we have in our big three key categories, we continue to have more newness than last year and continue to learn this sprin
componenttext: Well, John, I probably can't give you some specifics on what we've got going forward in the fall-holiday season for many reasons, but we have in our big three key categories, we continue to have more newness than last year and continue to learn this spring season. And as Sharen had mentioned, we are also working on the speed model. So the learnings that we have now, we're implementing into the third and fourth quarter for this year.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: As we think about fall and holiday, number one, we are excited about where we're headed for main product want, compared to last year as we have that in work in progress as we speak. When I think about Q3, we will have no sale. Last year, in September, we
componenttext: As we think about fall and holiday, number one, we are excited about where we're headed for main product want, compared to last year as we have that in work in progress as we speak. When I think about Q3, we will have no sale. Last year, in September, we had a big sale. We're looking at being full-priced, we're looking at turning faster. We're looking at continuing to focus on the bra and panty category. We're looking at to continue the leverage of bringing the brand story to life into the store, so that as we continue to drive traffic, get better execution, also continue to hopefully exceeding the record conversion. We will be entering the third quarter balancing the conservatism with optimism as we're getting very good traction in the business today with the macroeconomics being what they are. We want to keep as much agility as we can so that we can read and react. And I think that we're getting paid for those results by being conservative in the first quarter and we will continue that same thinking and discipline as we go into the third and fourth quarter. So we are very excited about the product.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: John, on La Senza, I think a couple of some messages are really the first thing to come to mind to me. So as you've seen in my remarks, we're making a lot of changes with our La Senza management team, our La Senza business, our La Senza brand. And so the
componenttext: John, on La Senza, I think a couple of some messages are really the first thing to come to mind to me. So as you've seen in my remarks, we're making a lot of changes with our La Senza management team, our La Senza business, our La Senza brand. And so the first key message is, the changes we're making are indicative of the fact that we're declaring that La Senza is a core brand to us on a worldwide basis. Our first priority is Canada, and the positioning of the brand and the assortment  in Canada and managing our way through the transitions that we're making with management team. Our second priority for La Senza will be the repositioning of the international franchise system of La Senza, which you may recall, is 400 stores distributed through 40 countries around the world. And the management team is very focused on how to re-engage with our international franchisees in a very positive and growth-oriented way. Beyond that, all kinds of things are possible, but we don't have any current plans or timelines attached to other ideas.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from Kimberly Greenberger of Citi.
componenttext: Your next question comes from Kimberly Greenberger of Citi.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: I was wondering, Sharen, if you could update us on your speed initiative. I think you had mentioned a goal of getting 40% to 50% of the key items at Victoria's Secret onto a six-week reorder or lead time. Where are you in that process? And ultimately, how
componenttext: I was wondering, Sharen, if you could update us on your speed initiative. I think you had mentioned a goal of getting 40% to 50% of the key items at Victoria's Secret onto a six-week reorder or lead time. Where are you in that process? And ultimately, how fast do you think you can get in terms of the core everyday products at Victoria's Secret?

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Right now, Kim, we are continuing to work to get better, and we have reduced our lead time about 50%. Today, we do have a robust basics program, which we're constantly flowing goods. And as I mentioned in my opening remarks is that, within the speed initi
componenttext: Right now, Kim, we are continuing to work to get better, and we have reduced our lead time about 50%. Today, we do have a robust basics program, which we're constantly flowing goods. And as I mentioned in my opening remarks is that, within the speed initiative, we made great progress, and I don't want to take anything away from the progress, but we're at the beginning of the beginning. And I think that there is a lot more for us to do in terms of how -- the basic piece is easy because that's just the constant flow of reorder in and out and get it through the distribution center, and our inventory availability in stores has gone up. Where we even want to get faster is in our ability around the fashion. As you know, fashion is where you have -- where you take your biggest risk. And I think that the ability for us now to have tested all of the fall colors already and have a great indicator of what colors are working and then being able to read and react to those and get those in within eight weeks. And I think there's even more opportunity to continue to compress the lead times. So we're at the beginning of the beginning of the journey. We're learning a lot, and we're going to continue to challenge ourselves to even get faster.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from Barbara Wyckoff of Jesup Lamont (sic) [Jesup & Lamont].
componenttext: Your next question comes from Barbara Wyckoff of Jesup Lamont (sic) [Jesup & Lamont].

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: I have a question for Sharen and for Diane. Sharen, with the success of the Nakeds collection and the Pink bras, how do you see the opportunity for this younger layer to add the younger layer to your core product mix? And then for Diane, with all the focu
componenttext: I have a question for Sharen and for Diane. Sharen, with the success of the Nakeds collection and the Pink bras, how do you see the opportunity for this younger layer to add the younger layer to your core product mix? And then for Diane, with all the focus on the three categories, other businesses have been -- like the Aromatherapy and Bigelow have been lacking in innovation and newness. Do you have any plans to tweak these categories as well?

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: It's Sharen. I'll take the first one -- is that we've been very pleased with our Pink assortment and the reaction that we've been getting. We also believe that the total Victoria's Secret positioning has gotten younger. We have now just recently launched
componenttext: It's Sharen. I'll take the first one -- is that we've been very pleased with our Pink assortment and the reaction that we've been getting. We also believe that the total Victoria's Secret positioning has gotten younger. We have now just recently launched Pout, which we do believe is actually a different kind of fit. It really comes off of Victoria, and we changed that to the name Pout. So it really fits in between Pink and the kind of the core bras of where we are. So I think between Pink, between Pout and then just the general assortments becoming younger in Victoria's Secret, we're well-positioned for that forever-young customer.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: And Barbara, as far as Bath & Body Works, tweak is probably the right word. We continue to add newness to things like Aromatherapy and Bigelow. In fact, we're restaging the entire lip category in Bigelow in the summer, which is majority of the Bigelow bus
componenttext: And Barbara, as far as Bath & Body Works, tweak is probably the right word. We continue to add newness to things like Aromatherapy and Bigelow. In fact, we're restaging the entire lip category in Bigelow in the summer, which is majority of the Bigelow business for us. So we are adding newness to these categories, but certainly not the same kind of focus as the big three.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from Michelle Clark of Morgan Stanley.
componenttext: Your next question comes from Michelle Clark of Morgan Stanley.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Question on your second quarter comp guidance of two to four, implying a notable slowdown versus up 10 in the first quarter despite easier compares. Just wondering if there's anything you're seeing out there, or is it just a degree of conservatism. And th
componenttext: Question on your second quarter comp guidance of two to four, implying a notable slowdown versus up 10 in the first quarter despite easier compares. Just wondering if there's anything you're seeing out there, or is it just a degree of conservatism. And then Sharen, if you can just give us the hit to the second quarter comp from the shorter VS semiannual sale.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: So with respect to our comp guidance for the second quarter, just to reiterate, three or four points that are most on our mind, the first is, that we are lapping significant promotion from last year. And as mentioned already and through the call, we inten
componenttext: So with respect to our comp guidance for the second quarter, just to reiterate, three or four points that are most on our mind, the first is, that we are lapping significant promotion from last year. And as mentioned already and through the call, we intend to be much less promotional in Q2. And then the last thing I would say is, we continue to manage this business very conservatively and with discipline. And so those are really the key messages around how we see comps for Q2, much less promotional, managing with conservatism and discipline.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: And then Michelle, actually the Victoria's Secret semiannual sale is not shorter, it is online...
componenttext: And then Michelle, actually the Victoria's Secret semiannual sale is not shorter, it is online...

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: The Victoria's Secret Direct is being shortened by five days. And honestly, I honestly believe that because we pulled back on all the promotions, that we will have created some pent-up demand. And I believe that we will be flat to last year, even shorteni
componenttext: The Victoria's Secret Direct is being shortened by five days. And honestly, I honestly believe that because we pulled back on all the promotions, that we will have created some pent-up demand. And I believe that we will be flat to last year, even shortening the sale.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from Dana Telsey with Telsey Advisory Group.
componenttext: Your next question comes from Dana Telsey with Telsey Advisory Group.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Lately, topline stability improvement certainly has been the trend. How is the AUR trending? And how do you see it moving forward, given the speed in fashion that's involved in both businesses? And just lastly, you've had good successful launches at Victo
componenttext: Lately, topline stability improvement certainly has been the trend. How is the AUR trending? And how do you see it moving forward, given the speed in fashion that's involved in both businesses? And just lastly, you've had good successful launches at Victoria's Secret, whether it's Miraculous, whether it's The Nakeds. What's being done differently to get these types of results than perhaps in the past?

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: It's Sharen, I can take the first one. The AUR is basically flat as we continue to balance the mix of the business, balance the good-better-best pricing, we have great growth between the balance between units and AUR. So we're very pleased with that. When
componenttext: It's Sharen, I can take the first one. The AUR is basically flat as we continue to balance the mix of the business, balance the good-better-best pricing, we have great growth between the balance between units and AUR. So we're very pleased with that. When I think about what we're doing differently from the launch perspective, is that we have been able to unlock how to get more incrementality from the total business as we go into launch. So the fact that we are bringing in bras -- the Miraculous is two cup sizes, and so what we're seeing is that bringing in that bra also looks sexy. Why would it look very sexy push up, because if someone doesn't want that kind of look they still have a great option in push up. The same thing with Nakeds, it's a lightly lined bra. So we're adding diversity within the assortment that helps us to continue to get more incrementality to the total business.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: And Dana, AUR at Bath & Body Works is down slightly to last year. But that is mainly due to mix as we have more of our business done in our top three categories, the AURs are lower than as we look at our performance brands, or even the third party brand o
componenttext: And Dana, AUR at Bath & Body Works is down slightly to last year. But that is mainly due to mix as we have more of our business done in our top three categories, the AURs are lower than as we look at our performance brands, or even the third party brand of business that we exited last year. But our EDS [electronic discount sales] is up slightly as a result.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from Erika Maschmeyer of Robert W. Baird.
componenttext: Your next question comes from Erika Maschmeyer of Robert W. Baird.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: You've done a great job of paying down debt. What's your goal and game here? Can you remind us of your philosophy? And then also, could you update on inventory turns by brand and what you think you're in for Bath & Body Works versus Victoria's Secret? I k
componenttext: You've done a great job of paying down debt. What's your goal and game here? Can you remind us of your philosophy? And then also, could you update on inventory turns by brand and what you think you're in for Bath & Body Works versus Victoria's Secret? I know you've recognized substantial benefits, particularly at Bath & Body in terms of lowering inventory and increasing in-stocks.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: So with respect to debt and our philosophy on capital structure, the first thing I would say is, we're very comfortable with our level of balance sheet debt, and our total debt as we commented on, we have reduced it about $400 million over the last six mo
componenttext: So with respect to debt and our philosophy on capital structure, the first thing I would say is, we're very comfortable with our level of balance sheet debt, and our total debt as we commented on, we have reduced it about $400 million over the last six months or so. And we're not seeking, per se, an investment-grade rating. What's important to us is that we have appropriate cash and liquidity, which we do, that we have flexibility, which we do. This business generates a lot of cash flow. We're comfortable with our balance sheet debt. The maturity profile, we've improved a lot over the last 18 months or so, so it's a very good maturity profile. We're very comfortable with our capital structure situation. With respect to inventory turns, we're not going to go into the details of that by business. But what I can tell you is that we have been improving turn in all our major business over the last 12 to 18 months. It's a key focus for us, but we're not going to go into the details of that by brand.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from Howard Tubin of RBC Capital Markets.
componenttext: Your next question comes from Howard Tubin of RBC Capital Markets.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Just maybe one question for you, Martyn. Can you update us on your plans and thoughts for the Victoria's Secret business outside of North America?
componenttext: Just maybe one question for you, Martyn. Can you update us on your plans and thoughts for the Victoria's Secret business outside of North America?

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Sure. As I mentioned in my remarks, Howard, we are planning to open our first Victoria's Secret full flagship stores in Canada in the late summer timeframe, four stores in Canada. That really is that test and validation for us of our ability to deliver th
componenttext: Sure. As I mentioned in my remarks, Howard, we are planning to open our first Victoria's Secret full flagship stores in Canada in the late summer timeframe, four stores in Canada. That really is that test and validation for us of our ability to deliver the Victoria's Secret full flagship, full-store brand to a foreign country. And that's the next major step in our development of Victoria's Secret outside of the United States. Beyond that, we have not announced any specific plans, and I think as we did with BBW, we used Canada as our test bed  for BBW and started that process a couple of years ago now, and as we move forward, we'll be looking for opportunities on a worldwide basis for Victoria's Secret, but taking a very cautious and careful approach. The other thing we are continuing to work on is the T&T concept or what we call T&T, which is travel and tourism, which is under the Victoria's Secret brand name. But as we described on previous calls, it's a hybrid accessories, beauty and limited intimate apparel assortment distributed through airport retail locations, as well as a couple of department stores, shop-in-shop kind of locations. And we're continuing to see very positive results from that, a pilot and learning experience and looking to continue to expand that in the balance of the year.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from Neely Tamminga of Piper Jaffray.
componenttext: Your next question comes from Neely Tamminga of Piper Jaffray.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Diane, I just had a question for you. You've had product insight, I think, longer than the VS division, and just wondering how some of the toolbox to read and react that Sharen often talks about, I think, is a good supplementary direction. But you guys ha
componenttext: Diane, I just had a question for you. You've had product insight, I think, longer than the VS division, and just wondering how some of the toolbox to read and react that Sharen often talks about, I think, is a good supplementary direction. But you guys have been able to already affect and do what's the business path can be for VS on the road to using those tools.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Well, I'm not quite sure the insight tools is what really gets you in the read an and react and the speed model. It's more about the headstart of the organization and us testing and learning from that agenda. And it's really about the actions and discipli
componenttext: Well, I'm not quite sure the insight tools is what really gets you in the read an and react and the speed model. It's more about the headstart of the organization and us testing and learning from that agenda. And it's really about the actions and discipline and execution that we have versus really using a systems tool.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from Marni Shapiro of The Retail Tracker.
componenttext: Your next question comes from Marni Shapiro of The Retail Tracker.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Sharen, I saw Pout and I thought it looks great, and I was curious more about Pink, how it fits in next to Pink? Will you really keep it as a separate agenda different on the floor? And then, also on Pink, you've done a very good job of taking some of the
componenttext: Sharen, I saw Pout and I thought it looks great, and I was curious more about Pink, how it fits in next to Pink? Will you really keep it as a separate agenda different on the floor? And then, also on Pink, you've done a very good job of taking some of the promotions from Victoria's Secret, the two-form bras the mix-and-match tees and tanks and bringing them to Pink. But you've continued to overlay that with the free flip-flop and things to that effect. So can you just talk about how you plan to strategize going forward, because it seems like you've pulled some parts from Victoria to Pink, but kept the Pink stuff there?

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Well, we didn't pull anything Victoria's Secret into Pink. So I think that what we're looking at from the Pink perspective and that positioning and it's really targeting to that 19-year-old collegiate girl we're sold in. It can also go down in age as well
componenttext: Well, we didn't pull anything Victoria's Secret into Pink. So I think that what we're looking at from the Pink perspective and that positioning and it's really targeting to that 19-year-old collegiate girl we're sold in. It can also go down in age as well. And so when we think about the two for 32, you have to buy both two bras that come together. It's almost, if you think about it, it's your first bra. In terms of Pout, it's a totally different positioning than Pink. It's really a lifestyle. It's more European in feeling, and it has a different fit than what Pink has.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: And will you continue to layer on the two-for promotions and keep the original Pink ones like the flip-flops?
componenttext: And will you continue to layer on the two-for promotions and keep the original Pink ones like the flip-flops?

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Well, I think that if you're talking about the GWPs, it's really a total Pink. And it's really a surprise and delight. So then when you think about wanting a piece of the Pink brand, we give away for coming and making a purchase and get a free dog. So we
componenttext: Well, I think that if you're talking about the GWPs, it's really a total Pink. And it's really a surprise and delight. So then when you think about wanting a piece of the Pink brand, we give away for coming and making a purchase and get a free dog. So we have pulled those things in and out as really a surprise and delight, and we will continue to do that.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your next question comes from Jeff Black of Barclays Capital.
componenttext: Your next question comes from Jeff Black of Barclays Capital.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: A question for Stuart and just how you're running the business here, and I know you said you were very promotional last year. But does the guidance really say anything about what you're seeing with traffic now, first? Second, do you think you have the abi
componenttext: A question for Stuart and just how you're running the business here, and I know you said you were very promotional last year. But does the guidance really say anything about what you're seeing with traffic now, first? Second, do you think you have the ability to chase into trends if you see some better sales trends as we saw in 1Q with comps well north of what you guided to? And third, if we look at the back half, is there anything -- or I guess what would change your thinking on how you inventory the business and what might move you to a more aggressive posture this year, if at all?

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: The four or five points that I would make that aren't just from my perspective, it's the perspective that the teams running the business is, there is some uncertainty in the environment, but you should interpret our guidance as some new view of that. As w
componenttext: The four or five points that I would make that aren't just from my perspective, it's the perspective that the teams running the business is, there is some uncertainty in the environment, but you should interpret our guidance as some new view of that. As we commented on, we remain comfortable with our May cotton guidance of flat to low single digits, would be a point to reiterate. Another point to reiterate is, again, affecting those numbers is doing a lot less promotion this year than we did a year ago. And maybe two more points, we continue to manage this business in a conservative way. It's really paid dividends for us over the last 18 to 24 months. We talked earlier in this call about flow-through. You get that great flow-through when you manage the business conservatively. And looping back to a part of your question, we are able to chase goods. Both Sharen and Diane have commented previously, and again, today, about their focus along with the sourcing part of the organization and working with our sourcing partners about continuing to work hard to reduce lead times and have more agility, have more open to buy, and that absolutely allows us to read and react and chase in shorter periods of time. And we certainly have done that through the fall of last year and again this quarter. So I think those are our key headsets, if you will, our points of view, as it relates to the sales line and things around that for the balance of the year.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your last question comes from Roxanne Meyer of UBS.
componenttext: Your last question comes from Roxanne Meyer of UBS.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: My question is relating to Victoria's Secret Direct. How do you see the opportunity to grow the business, I guess, in part, keeping in mind, how far apparel has come versus last year? What categories are currently under-penetrated on online? And when do y
componenttext: My question is relating to Victoria's Secret Direct. How do you see the opportunity to grow the business, I guess, in part, keeping in mind, how far apparel has come versus last year? What categories are currently under-penetrated on online? And when do you think you will begin to grow Victoria's Secret Direct internationally, knowing that it does take time to build up that infrastructure but perhaps that might be the best opportunity?

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: I think there's a couple of categories that we are under-penetrated in. The two are, which are our priorities right now, online, Pink, as well as Beauty. So those are the two big categories that were under-penetrated on that tie back to the brands that we
componenttext: I think there's a couple of categories that we are under-penetrated in. The two are, which are our priorities right now, online, Pink, as well as Beauty. So those are the two big categories that were under-penetrated on that tie back to the brands that we have big opportunity. As I told you earlier, we are starting a Pink catalog as we go into the fall season. Today, in the Direct business, we do about $200 million internationally, without really doing anything different. We do believe that there is an international opportunity, but as the team really is looking at all of our international strategies, the Direct piece will be part of that, so there will be looking forward to more news on that subject later.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
componenttextpreview: Thank, Sharen. So we thank all of you for joining us this morning, and we thank you for your continuing interest in Limited Brands. Thanks.
componenttext: Thank, Sharen. So we thank all of you for joining us this morning, and we thank you for your continuing interest in Limited Brands. Thanks.

headline: Limited Brands Inc., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, May 20, 2010
